diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
diagnoses.reasoning: Can cause a wide range of symptoms, including dry eyes (Sicca symptoms), and hematologic abnormalities such as monocytosis.

diagnoses.name: Diabetes Mellitus
diagnoses.reasoning: Hypoglycemia is a common complication, especially in treated patients.

diagnoses.name: Sjögren's Syndrome
diagnoses.reasoning: Primary symptoms include dry eyes and can also be associated with hematologic abnormalities.

diagnoses.name: Carcinoid Syndrome
diagnoses.reasoning: Characterized by flushing and can indirectly lead to hypoglycemia; though monocytosis is less directly associated, systemic effects could potentially influence blood counts.

diagnoses.name: Anxiety Disorders
diagnoses.reasoning: Obsessive-compulsive behavior is a common manifestation. While not directly leading to the other symptoms, the stress response can exacerbate or correlate with other symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Primary Immunodeficiency Disorders
diagnoses.reasoning: Could explain monocytosis due to chronic immune activation and might have associations with autoimmune manifestations causing symptoms like dry eyes.

diagnoses.name: Thyroid Disorders
diagnoses.reasoning: Hyperthyroidism could potentially cause hypoglycemia, flushing, and contribute to psychiatric symptoms such as obsessive behavior.

diagnoses.name: Pheochromocytoma
diagnoses.reasoning: Though rare, it can cause hypoglycemia and flushing due to its episodic release of catecholamines.

diagnoses.name: Behçet's Disease
diagnoses.reasoning: This systemic vasculitis can cause a wide range of symptoms including eye problems, skin manifestations like flushing, and can be associated with neuropsychiatric symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Myelodysplastic Syndromes
diagnoses.reasoning: Can lead to monocytosis and indirectly cause symptoms like flushing due to anemia or infection. The relationship with the other symptoms is less direct.

symptoms: dyspnea with normal pulmonary function tests

diagnoses: Vitamin and Mineral Deficiencies (e.g., Vitamin D)

diagnoses.description: Obstructive Sleep Apnea Syndrome
Chronic Bronchitis
Acute Bronchitis
Noninfective Vaginitis
Leukopenia, Unspecified
Bacterial Vaginosis
Refractive Error, Unspecified
Myopic Astigmatism
Candidal Vaginitis
Hypersomnia due to Obstructive Sleep Apnea

diagnoses: Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) / Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome (AIDS)

diagnoses.name: Celiac Disease
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disorder where the ingestion of gluten leads to damage in the small intestine, causing malabsorption, and can lead to dermatitis herpetiformis, a hypersensitivity reaction.

diagnoses.name: Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD)
diagnoses.description: Disorders that involve chronic inflammation of your digestive tract, such as Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis, can cause malabsorption and hypersensitivity reactions.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
diagnoses.description: A chronic autoimmune disease that can cause inflammation and pain in any part of your body. It can lead to hearing loss, palpitations, and lymphadenopathy.

diagnoses.name: Sjögren's Syndrome
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disease that attacks the glands that provide lubrication to the eyes and mouth. It can also cause systemic issues, including lymphadenopathy and hypersensitivity reactions.

diagnoses.name: Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma
diagnoses.description: A type of lymphoma, which is a cancer that begins in the lymphatic system. It can cause lymphadenopathy, and systemic symptoms like fever and weight loss.

diagnoses.name: Whipple’s Disease
diagnoses.description: A rare bacterial infection that can affect the joints, heart, and nervous system. It leads to malabsorption due to the thickening and damage to the intestinal mucosa.

diagnoses.name: HIV/AIDS
diagnoses.description: Human immunodeficiency virus/acquired immunodeficiency syndrome can cause a variety of symptoms including lymphadenopathy, hypersensitivity reactions, and malabsorption due to gastrointestinal infections.

diagnoses.name: Sarcoidosis
diagnoses.description: An inflammatory disease characterized by the formation of granulomas, clumps of inflammatory cells, in various organs including the lymph nodes, which can cause lymphadenopathy.

diagnoses.name: Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis (Wegener's)
diagnoses.description: A rare disorder that causes inflammation of the blood vessels in your nose, sinuses, throat, lungs, and kidneys. Can lead to symptoms like hypersensitivity reactions due to inflammatory processes.

diagnoses.name: Lyme Disease
diagnoses.description: An infectious disease caused by Borrelia bacteria, spread by ticks. It can cause a wide range of symptoms, including palpitations (Lyme carditis), hypersensitivity reactions, and, in later stages, hearing loss.

diagnoses: Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) / Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome (AIDS)
